Meta.Documentation:
Transform arrays/lists into maps (and vice versa when parsing), by using the member identified by "keyName" as the key for the map-entries.
Example: pathToList=list keyName=id
=> transforms
{"list" : [{"id" : 0, "x" : "y"}, {"id" : 1, "x" : "y2"}]}
into
{"list" : {"0" : {"id" : 0, "x" : "y"}, "1" : {"id" : 1, "x : "y2"}}}
Map keys will be converted into strings, if they were numbers or booleans.

Path given by member var names (not labels!), separated by dots. If member var name is a list, then append "[]", except if path ends with the list.
Example: router.interfaces vs router.interfaces[].supportedtypes
Member var name to use as map key. Keys may not be null.
